Posts.Content: Mar 19, 2013 09:10AM Lorial1962 wrote: I also struggled with this. I didn't want to tell my pregnant daughter or my parents until I knew the whole prognosis. After I got my pathology report back after my surgery I went ahead and told them. After that I was not afraid to tell people and it was almost liberating since I had been keeping quiet for almost a month. I even created a website over the weekend to keep everyone up to date on my treatment. I inboxed a linked to all my female friends on Facebook over the weekend. Everyone has been so supportive, if I spur at least one person to schedule their mammogram then it's worth publicizing it like I did. Everyone handles things different was, the important thing is that you do it the way that is most comfortable to you. Here is the link to my website: lorial1962.simpl.com/
